title: Technology Developer Venture Startups
company: Fraunhofer Institute for Telecommunications, Heinrich Hertz Institute (HHI)
description:
The Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft currently operates 76 institutes and research units throughout Germany and is a leading applied research organization. Around 32,000 employees work with an annual research budget of 3.4 billion euros.

If you're passionate about startups, we're excited to introduce you to this fantastic opportunity at HHI. Our vision? To accelerate the creation of groundbreaking, technology-driven startups. To do this, we rely on talent like YOU - with a mix of deep-tech projects, financial support, professional space, and a strong network of mentors and coaches. The Tech Venture Developer is responsible for identifying, validating, and advancing technological solutions based on HHI research results. This includes prototype development, feasibility assessment, and collaboration with interdisciplinary teams to achieve market readiness.
requirements: University degree (Bachelor/Master) in computer science, engineering, electrical engineering, or related field
Experience in development and implementation of technological solutions
Sound knowledge in prototypes, software architectures, and IT systems
Experience in working with interdisciplinary teams
Strong skills in leading technical teams
Very good knowledge of German and English
responsibilities: Analysis and identification of promising technologies and research results of the HHI
Selection and implementation of suitable technologies and software architectures
Integration of user feedback and market data into technological development
Evaluation of technical feasibility and market potential
Prototyping and implementation in MVPs and scalable systems
Carrying out technology tests and validation processes
Interdisciplinary collaboration with product venture developers
Development of technological roadmaps for product scaling
